result.execSummary:
The defendant Rafael Olivarez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Reckless Homicide, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.02(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: THE DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS SHALL DEDUCT RESTITUTION AND ALL OTHER COURT OBLIGATIONS AT THE RATE OF 25% OF ALL MONIES RECEIVED WHILE INCARCERATED.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay court costs and Department of Corrections Supervision fees.    If the defendant is discharged from Extended Supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
----------------------------------

No contact with victim's family or their residences, or with the victim's relatives, if known. The defendant, however, will be allowed contact with Rebecca Perez who is only related to the victim by marriage and not by blood. She is not connected to the victim or victim's family and wants contact with the defendant.
----------------------------------
Absolute sobriety.
----------------------------------
No bars or liquor stores.
----------------------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.
----------------------------------

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.   Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.
----------------------------------

Defendant Rafael  Olivarez in court, in custody with attorney Edward J. Hunt.  Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  

**05/05/2016 - Transcript FILED;  Court Reporter:  Sandra Elderbrook  (df)
BOND QUASHED
Application for Jail Time Credit form
DA Service Fees Invoice #201600352            $60.00
DA Service Fees Invoice #201600351            $60.00

3:49 pm  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Rafael  Olivarez in court, in custody with attorney Edward J. Hunt.  
Matter is before the Court on the Defendant's Motion for reconsideration of the previous ruling relating to the incamera inspection of Fred Quirino records relating to his mental health.  
The information that the deft uncovered was from the sentencing hearing of Mr. Quirino.  
Court still has some concerns that the Court would like Atty Hunt to address.  
Response by Attorney Hunt.  
4:08 pm  Court makes record as to its belief that the core relevancy question has to be made at the time of trial.  
Before any question about that could occur, there would need to be a hearing outside the presence of the jury.
4:09 pm  Response by Atty Necci to Atty Hunt's motion for reconsideration relating to incamera inspection.  
4:13 pm  Response by Atty Hunt.  
4:15 pm  Response by Atty Necci.  
4:17 pm  Court makes record as to information contained within the previously filed Affidavit of Mr. Olivarez.  Court believes there is a relevancy component to a Shiffra Green analysis and a showing of an incamera review is necessary.  Nothing presented in court today changes the Court's decision.  Court denies Motion for reconsideration.  
4:20 pm  Court in recess.
*TRANSCRIPT FILED - 12/14/2016 Court Reporter : Katie Giebel
Letter Brief
Letter/Brief
For Court To Reconsider Court's Previous Ruling on in Camera Inspection
Defendant's Motion for Consideration of Court's  Previous Ruling
of Authority on Defendant's Right to Cross-Examine

9:34 a.m.  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Rafael  Olivarez in court, in custody with attorney Edward J. Hunt.  
Matter is before the Court on Motions that were filed by the Defense
9:35 a.m.  Court will first deal with the McMorris evidence Motion.  
Court notes that a factual basis for self defense first needs to be established before going any further with the Motion.
Discussion between Court and Attorneys.  
Attorney Hunt believes it is too early to make a call as to whether the defendant is entitled to exercise self defense.  
Attorney Necci argues that the question is "have they adequately raised self-defense?" 
Attorney Necci believes it is a determination that the Court has to make at trial.  
Response by Attorney Necci to Court question as to statements made by defendant to the Officers. 
Attorney Hunt believes that McMorris requires an affirmative obligation of the defense to come forward ahead of time
Court will take this under advisement and at such time that Attorney Hunt believes there has been an adequate basis for self-defense, then this can be addressed.
Court makes a record with regard to Defense Motion to Exclude Other Acts Evidence.
Attorney Necci advises that the State has no basis or knowledge of anything the State would consider an other act.  
Attorney Hunt makes a record as to incidents of violence by the victim.  
Attorney Hunt believes he can only introduce things that the Defendant was actually aware of but if there is some introduction through
other witnesses that the victim had a reputation for peacefulness, then Attorney Hunt would be able to go into that.  
Response by Attorney Necci.  
Court next deals with the Shiffra Green Motion.  
Deft needs to establish a specific factual basis demonstrating a reasonable liklihood that the privileged records are relevant.
Discussion between Court and Attorneys.  
Court does not believe the Defense has met their burden.  
Court denies request for the in camera inspection.  
Discussion between Court and Attorneys with regard to response by witness to questions asked by Counsel at trial related to this issue.
Court would want this matter heard outside presence of the Jury and would like the parties to brief this matter.  
10:17 a.m.  Court in recess.  

*TRANSCRIPT FILED 12/19/2016 : Court Reporter: Eileen Walsh Grzenia
State's Brief in response to the Defendant's Motion to admit McMorris Evidence

State's Brief in response to Defendant's Motion for in camera inspection of psychological, psychiatric treatment records, competency evaluations and department of corrections records regarding mental health history and tratment of Fred Quirino including, but not limited to, presentence investigation report, prison treatment records and Walworth County Jail records regarding mental health treatment records.

Defendant Rafael Olivarez in court, in custody with attorney Edward J. Hunt.  
Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Matter is scheduled for a 5 day Jury Trial to begin on Monday.  
Attorney Hunt was just recently appointed on this case.  He is the 2nd Attorney assigned to this case.
Attorney Hunt advises there is voluminous discovery that he needs to review and is asking for a trial date in May.  
Mr. Olivarez has no objection to this.
Attorney Necci also has no objection to setting the trial out to May. 
The Court has another older case on its calendar that will be going to trial this coming Monday.  
Court schedules new FPT and JT dates.  
Court also extends the deadline for filing Motions to December 8th.  
Final pre-trial scheduled for April 27, 2016 at 02:30 pm.  
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for May 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Rafael Olivarez in court, in custody with attorney Travis Schwantes and  Julia M May.  Daniel A Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court in session @ 9:46 a.m. State calls Officer James Berlin who is duly sworn and reponds to direct exam by attorney Necci. 
9:49 a.m. Cross exam by Attorney Schwantes
Witness excused @ 9:53 a.m.
9:53 a.m. State calls Detective Smith who is duly sworn and responds to direct exam by attorney Necci. State's exhibit S-1 identified and marked (copy of the complaint). State moves exhibit S-1 into evidence. Objection by attorney Schwantes. Court overrules and receives state's exhibit S-1.
9:57 a.m. - Cross exam by attorney Schwantes.
10:02 a.m. - Witness excused. No further witnesses for the State. Defense has no witnesses. Evidence closed.
Argument by attorney Necci
Argument by attorney Schwantes
Response by the Court that he agrees with the Court that the State's witnesses alone do not meet the standard of probable cause alone. However based on the totality of the evidence with the exhibit, State finds probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Court in recess @ 10:07 a.m.  Arraignment scheduled for June 5, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Bail Bond Hearing before the Honorable James L Carlson on May 6, 2014.
Court Reporter: Rhonda S Boss

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not possess any guns or other weapons.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH B.G., HER CHILDREN OR RESIDENCE.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
